data.name: Distance to swim
data.description:
A swimmer wants to cross a river with a flow rate `v_r` [m/s]. 
He swims with the speed `v_s` [m/s].

The river has a width of `w_r` [m].

Can you tell him the distance `d` [m] he needs to swim when he crosses the river?

Write a function that takes the `flow-rate`, the `swim-speed` and the `river-width`. The function should return the distance that the swimmer needs to swim.

**Invalid input values such as negative river width or zero swim speed are not considered.**

Hint here is a sketch of the situation:
```
                         T Target position of the simmer
-----------------------------------
  -->            |      /
  -->            |     /
  -->            |    /
  -->        w_r |   / d
  -->            |  /
  -->            | /
  -->            |/
-----------------------------------
                 X Start position of the swimmer
```
